alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 10:19PM EST until January 05 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION TO MAKE FOR SLIPPERY TRAVEL LATE TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move south of New England later today and tonight. It will initially start as rain except for in the mountains where snow and sleet is likely. Cooler air works southward across the region tonight and tomorrow changing the precipitation to a mix of light snow (confined mainly to the north), sleet, and freezing rain which should continue through at least Thursday morning allowing for slippery travel. Freezing drizzle is likely at times afterward with light snow occasionally mixing in. Further south, temperatures will take longer to cool however freezing drizzle and some freezing rain will be possible at times through the daylight hours of Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 5 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain and freezing drizzle are expected. Total ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Western and Central Hillsborough, Cheshire, Eastern Hillsborough, and Interior Rockingham Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 5 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will be less intense during the day Thursday however freezing drizzle may still produce hazardous driving conditions, especially on untreated roads.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org

area.areaDesc: Cheshire; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Western And Central Hillsborough
